docs.text: web foundations This site serves as a simple foundation introduction to the internet and issues related to web. Students were assigned different topics to research and explore. In addition to writing a short introduction to their topic, students were required to create a relevant illustration and include links to additional resources. Each student is credited on their individual page. digital media & design The Digital Media and Design program is the visual design course at the Eaton RESA Career Preparation Center at Lansing Community College . Students are high-school juniors and seniors attending college level classes and potentially earning college credit. Over the course of one school year, students are introduced to basic Design and Communication concepts, computer graphic design using Photoshop, and Web Design development. These courses are foundation classes in the Art & Design program at LCC. Chad Bennett is the course instructor. Please direct any questions or comments to him. the site This site was created using the MKDocs site generation system with a modified version of the Material theme by squidfunk . All content was collected, curated, and created by the students of the Digital Media & Design program.
docs.title: home

docs.text: Coding Languages by Chaz Dyer image design © Chaz Dyer The internet of things IOT for short runs on an insane amount of languages that are used for many various purposes. Whether its server side communications, running cloud services or formatting and presenting a website to the user in a digestible manner and that precisely is what I will be going over with this article. For the purpose of being cursory I will only be discussing the main languages used today according to the research I have done. HTML HTML also known as Hyper Text Markup Language is the main markup language used for the displaying of documents in a web browser. HTML is very rarely seen on its own; it’s more of a framework that most websites will build off of mainly using html’s ability to embed scripts using javascript to change the way a website will function upon launch and css as a method of formatting and laying out the content. C Another forerunner of development in the IOT is C not only for its low amount of resources taken up which allows it to be used widely whether its on a wide array of hardware or being the framework for many other languages but also the fact that it is procedural instead of object oriented which goes great with the fact that C is compiled. Java Java is the most popular language used for web development; and also goes on to many other uses which include game development, software engineering and development on the android platform. Java is so widely used to a point where some studies have shown that over 15 billion devices have used an instance of java. Python Python is a programming language with a highly readable syntax being able to be interpreted and used in a way that more complex languages can not while still not compromising on what it is able to deliver which make it suitable for data analysis in a lot of cases. Javascript Java and Javascript tend to get confusing to tell the difference between quite a bit so let me explain; Java needs to be compiled and relies on the hardware whereas javascript is just text along with being more website oriented and because of that javascript does not have the functionality of making applets instead mainly being embedded in html web pages requiring different plugins or additional libraries to make it work References What programming languages rule the internet of things top six coding languages for IOT projects common web design languages what they do and why you need them java help page
docs.title: coding languates

docs.text: General Intro to Internet: Hardware by Emilee Allwardt image design © name To access the internet, some basic hardware is needed. These basic components are needed in order to access, store, recieve, and transfer digital data to and from the internet. What Hardware Infrastucture is Needed Modem: Allows a computer or router to connect to the internet. Since most internet connections are through telephone lines, modems are used to convert digital data into analogue signals (used for telephone lines). Modern modems have built-in routers. Router: Sends and recieves data on the internet. Reads digital data and decides where to send it. Also stores IP addresses (internet protocol addresses) that tell the location you are accessing the internet at. Allows multiple devices to connect to the same internet connection at once. Network Interface Card (NIC): Connects individual devices to a network. It is usually built into the device. Can be wireless or wired. Wireless is through Wi-fi signals, while wired connections are through network cables. Wired connections send data faster and is more secure than wireless. Resources wikipedia ictlounge gcfglobal techfaq
docs.title: hardware

These areas include Logos, Photos, Illustrations, Mascots, and 3D Renders. What can images do? They can draw attention and trigger an emotional response. They can help users to orientate Background images create atmosphere Tips for using images Make sure the images are relevant Use original images Don't use just photos Think about cropping and resizing Use multiple images for products Integrate icons Optimize your images RESOURCES Usabilla Webfx Tubik Studio

docs.text: in-browser coding tools by Lowell Halliwill image design by © Lowell Halliwill What are they? In-browser coding tools. Every modern computer has these powerful tools. Some of these powerful tools inspect HTML, javascript, and CSS. These tools allow you to do a variety of things to web developers' code, like debugging and testing it. These tools make it so you can see how other people produce their websites using code. Each browser is a little different in how it works but overall it's pretty interesting and once you understand what they do they can be a huge help. How they work To inspect any page's code by using browser developer tools simply right click and click inspect or inspect element. Once you click inspect it should bring up a small tab that shows you all the elements used to create and put together the website you are on. Along with the element panel, there is a style panel. This contains the CSS It also allows you to see the console, sources, network, performance, memory, application, and security. You can also pinpoint a certain element you may want to inspect by highlighting it first then right-click and click inspect. You can also put your code on the page. Of course, none of this will change the view of the page for others but it will temporarily change your view until you refresh the page. What they are used for In browser coding tools are used for a lot of things. They can be used to see a page's HTML or CSS. They can be used for help or inspiration on creating your HTML or CSS. It can be used to temporarily see how a page would look if you changed a line of code or switched up the CSS. They make no direct creations of a webpage nor do they edit them, but they are used for web applications and user interfaces. Differences by browser Each browser coding tool changes depending on which browser you decide on using. For example, Google comes with Chrome DevTools. In other browsers you may have to download dev tools on your own or choose between several different dev tools to download. An example of this would be Mozilla Firefox. With Firefox you get to choose between either getting Firebug or Firefox Developer Edition. For the most part, the coding tools are all pretty similar and most of them get the job done. It's never a terrible thing though to go and check out different browser coding tools to test and compare and see which one you like better. resources this is where you list your sources and links: essential tools for front-end development what are browser development tools front-end development tools using the browser developer tools edge F12 vs firefox and chrome javascript debugging tools
docs.title: in-browser coding tools

docs.text: javascript frameworks by your Maryn Moore image design by © Maryn Moore Javascript is a “language” where one scripts to create and control web developments such as slideshows, graphics, and forms that can be interacted with. Javascript frameworks are basically pre-coded things that you might need that you can take the code from and apply it to what you need to do. A couple of the big frameworks: ReactJs, Vue, jQuery. ReactJs : Its used to build websites with interactive components. These can be menus, search bars, buttons, etc. Vue : Is a progressive framework that is used to build user interfaces. It is designed to be extremely easy to pick up and able to be put into other projects that are already existing. jQuery : A fast form of the javascript frameworks library. It makes the HTML document(s) much easier to manipulate, handle, and use animation. It also works across many browsers. resources this is where you list your sources and links: what is a javascript framework what is reactjs view js guide jquery
docs.title: javascript

docs.text: Internet Issues: Logins/User Access * by Jose Grace image design by your © Jose Grace Logins are used by websites/computer applications and mobile apps. They are a security system designed to prevent unauthorized access to confidental data. When many attempts fail(when a username/password does not match the orginal information entered) the user will not be granted access. Many applications block users from trying to login after multiple failed attempts. User access is a way for one to have a personalized account on a application/website to do/enjoy what the functions and activities the website/application provides. What forms of user access exist? The basic and most used form of loggining is simpily entering in a email followed up with a password. Some sites/applications will have you enter in a username as well, once that is all set; most applications/websites will have you verify the email you used. Websites/applications have alternative ways to login, such as a numeraic pin. A pin, you simpily enter numeraic digits, usually only about four or five characters. What limitations come with user access? Limitations involve the information you use to create/access your account through the site/application. This is by the means of the username/password and email used and so on. The information you used is to be secured by the website/applicaitons but includes your own doing as well, say you input a username/password that is simple with little characters; this causes some risk to your accounts. It makes it easy for hackers to gain access, hense why websites/applications usually ask for a strong and concise username/password, this also applies to your email. I'd say even more so because your email is the main source for all of your accounts you have made for different websites/applications; If you're username/password for your email is simple with little characters it could make it easier for hackers to gain access to your email/access to all accounts associated to thus email. What new formats might there be? Theres more to user access than just inserting a username and password. Over the years of developing user access, developers have come up with new ways of accessing accounts on different websites/applications. The use of the finger print came into being, a more personal function to indentifiying the users identity by just pressing your finger on a device or extention. Other examples include, MagicLinks( A authorized link to your email/pretty basic), Key Fobs(small plastic discs that contain internal technology) and also, ID Cards or physical tokens. I hope this infomration was helpful in some form of way and drew in interest, if you would like to learn more on user access there some links at the bottom of the page you can search through. Resources: TechTerms Designmodo RenovaData Swoopnow
docs.title: logins/access

docs.text: Networks, data transmission protocols, http, isp, dns by your Gabriel Pusey image design © Gabriel Pusey The Networks of the internet are one of the most important aspects of the internet and one of the reasons we are able to talk and communicate with others from long distances. A Computer Network is an interconnection of multiple computers that use multiple paths used to sending and or receiving data. Computer Networks have two different types of systems they use: open system and closed system. In an open system, the system is connected to the network and can communicate with the other devices, while a closed system cannot communicate with the devices because it is not connected to the network. Data transmission protocols allow computers to exchange and interpret data in a network. The Protocol is basically the link to the network and figures out the data to give to the said network. Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (or https for short) is the primary protocol used to send between a web browser and a website. This protocol is heavily encrypted due to keep sensitive information and data of the user safe like your bank account or health provider. An Internet Service Provider (or a isp for short) is an organization that provides methods or services that gives you the ability to access and use the Internet. Some examples of internet service providers are Xfinity, AT&T, Spectrum, and Verizon. The Domain Name System (or dns for short) is the naming system for computers and other devices connected to the Internet. In simple terms, it works like a phonebook, but for the Internet. resources none yet.
docs.title: networks

docs.text: Protect your internet experience by Nolan Schaeding image design © Nolan Schaeding the internet a virtual world where you can look up anything you want whenever you want like looking up memes on Google but what if the site you're looking on was looking at you as well looking a you face personality and the stuff that you are searching up sure but that's what Google is supposed to do to make a profit but where there internet there’s usually hackers lurking about and they would want your information for many reasons like black mail or money and other uses but there are ways of protecting your information. In the first recourse this is an article on NPR it talks about tips to protect yourself on the internet and one of these tips is to use an app to do encrypted messaging to friends and family so that hackers won’t know what you’re saying to the people you're talking to. Why is it important to have privacy on the internet well first of all it’s privacy it’s like the most important thing on the internet and in a article on TeachPrivacy one of the tips on that one is reputation management, reputation is important especially when it comes to the internet and when it says “Although we can’t have complete control over reputation we must have some ability to protect our reputation from being unfairly harmed” It really gets you thinking. There are many risk when you are guarding you personal information on the internet that can affect your entertainment and your financial services but if you can protect your information it will be safe. resources TTIT 10R IP AU
docs.title: privacy

docs.text: Internet issue -- security threats, what are they, how to deal with them Written by Karen Mitchell image design by your © Karen Mitchell There are lots of security issues you can encounter on the internet. Have you ever had to take your computer to a store to get it fixed because it had a virus or it crashed? Maybe you clicked on a link to a website that was corrupt, or had a virus coded in it. Sometimes when this happens you do not even now that it has happened. When you get a virus on your device it can go from just one website link to spread to the whole device. Which might lead to you losing the whole device or a lot of personal information. A computer virus is a piece of programmed code that has been created to copy itself into other codes or computer files. Virus can go and destroy data and programmed code. These viruses are grouped under one name called malware. Malware is simply any software that is intentionally designed to cause damage. Types of malware are file infecting, macro virus, browser hijacker, web scripting, and many more. Ways to deal with viruses is to get virus protection on your device. Usually when you buy a computer it will come with some type of virus protection, or you will get offered one. Some virus protectors out there are Total AV, PcProtect, McAfee, AGV, and many more. The reason why you should have virus protection is to stop you from getting viruses on your computer. Antivirus software works by scanning incoming code and files that come through your network. Other common security threats out there are spyware, adware and trojan horse. Spyware and adware is software that is used to track your web browsing habits and start giving you ad pop ups about those things. Trojan horse refers to hackers tricking people into letting them into their computers server. Some other internet threats are phishing, DDOS, and computer worms. In conclusion, you should really have some type of antivirus software on your computer. Even if you think you are being careful and safe. The truth is in this day and age hackers are getting smarter and sneeker. So make sure you do not click on emails that look suspicious to you if you have no idea where it came from. Also if you ever get random text messages from unknown numbers with content that you have no idea about, it is safe to assume it is a virus. resources Antivirus software How does Antivirus Different types of virus Top 10 Common Security Threats
docs.title: security

Trojan horse refers to hackers tricking people into letting them into their computers server. Some other internet threats are phishing, DDOS, and computer worms. In conclusion, you should really have some type of antivirus software on your computer. Even if you think you are being careful and safe. The truth is in this day and age hackers are getting smarter and sneeker. So make sure you do not click on emails that look suspicious to you if you have no idea where it came from. Also if you ever get random text messages from unknown numbers with content that you have no idea about, it is safe to assume it is a virus.
docs.title: Internet issue -- security threats, what are they, how to deal with them

docs.text: Antivirus software How does Antivirus Different types of virus Top 10 Common Security Threats
docs.title: resources

docs.text: software by Gillian Clara image design © Gillian Clara Software, what is it? Software is a set of instructions, data or programs that are used to operate a computer and complete specific tasks. Software is the complete opposite of hardware, which describes the physical aspects of a computer. Software is the generic term used to refer to applications, scripts and programs that run on a specific device. This can be thought of as a variable part of a computer, while hardware is an invariable part of a computer. Next, there is software infrastructures. Infrastructures are the main components required to operate and manage enterprise IT environments. These components include hardware, software, networking components, an operating system (OS), and data storage. All of these components are used to deliver IT services and solutions. To continue onto software categories, these are groups of software. They allow software to be understood in terms of those components. Typically, there are two major classifications of software, system software and application software. System software aids the user and the hardware to function and interact with each other. In simple words, you could say that the system software is an intermediary or a middle layer between the user and the hardware. Some things that fall under this category are operating system, device drivers, firmware, programming language translators and utility. Furthermore, application software, also known as end-user programs or productivity programs. These are software that helps the user in completing tasks such as doing online research, jotting down some notes, setting an alarm, designing graphics, keeping an account log, ect. They lie right above the system software. Unlike system software, they are used by the end-user and are specific to their functionality or tasks, they do the jobs that they are designed to do. Some things that fall under this category are word processors, database software, multimedia software, education and references software, graphics software and web browsers. There is a lot of information about software; these are just some of the basics to know. resources none yet.
docs.title: software

docs.text: General Intro to Web development: Storage, Bandwidths and Backups by Karlie Morey image design by © Karlie Morey Web Development Understanding Web development. Web development is the process of constructing and maintaining a website. It also consists of all the small details and fine tuning of a website that makes it function and look great. There are two parts that make up the web development field. Those two fields are called the front-end devs and the back-end devs. The “front-end” refers to the user interface side and the “back-end” is the server side. The “front-end” is what you see and interact with. Such as the text, dropdown menus and over all, all visual aspects. The “back-end” devs are what runs the website and what keeps it functioning and running. Which consists of all the data, data storage, and programs that make the website up to date and efficient. Storage What is storage? Storage is basically the amount of data that is and can be stored on your website. To store data on the internet you will need a server. Servers are what help us store data on the internet. The capacity of said servers will tell you how much storage you have. However, storage is not an infinite thing. This is because servers are physical objects that take up space and have a certain capacity for running numbers. Bandwidth Bandwidth and storage are often confused for one another. Bandwidth is the connectivity of servers and data. It also relatively refers to the amount of data transferred. To be more specific bandwidth can also be referred to as the measured amount of data being sent back and forth from website to server. A good example of bandwidth is traffic. Imagine there are 3,300 cars that need to go down the same road to get to their destination. A road needs to be built accordingly. Therefore the road should be built so that it can maintain 4,000 cars to be more efficient and avoid the risk of any possible traffic jams. Backups When important documents or important information that is copied and stored apart from its original copy. It is to ensure that the information won't get lost. This is the process of a backup. There are different types of backups. One being a Full backup. A full backup refers to copying everything that is deemed important. And is generally the copy of the first most reliable document. The second type of backup is an incremental backup. This type of backup will save space and time by detecting that all the files in the full backup will remain the same. The third and final type of backup is the Differential backup. The differential backup is almost identical to the incremental file. Except with the differential backup, all the files created since the original full backup will always be copied again. resources web development definition storage bandidth and connectivity difference between storage and bandwidth types of backup mistakes to avoid
docs.title: storage

Those two fields are called the front-end devs and the back-end devs. The “front-end” refers to the user interface side and the “back-end” is the server side. The “front-end” is what you see and interact with. Such as the text, dropdown menus and over all, all visual aspects. The “back-end” devs are what runs the website and what keeps it functioning and running. Which consists of all the data, data storage, and programs that make the website up to date and efficient.

Servers are what help us store data on the internet. The capacity of said servers will tell you how much storage you have. However, storage is not an infinite thing. docs.text: Bandwidth and storage are often confused for one another. Bandwidth is the connectivity of servers and data. It also relatively refers to the amount of data transferred. To be more specific bandwidth can also be referred to as the measured amount of data being sent back and forth from website to server. A good example of bandwidth is traffic. Imagine there are 3,300 cars that need to go down the same road to get to their destination. A road needs to be built accordingly. Therefore the road should be built so that it can maintain 4,000 cars to be more efficient and avoid the risk of any possible traffic jams.
docs.title: Bandwidth

docs.text: When important documents or important information that is copied and stored apart from its original copy. It is to ensure that the information won't get lost. This is the process of a backup. There are different types of backups. One being a Full backup. A full backup refers to copying everything that is deemed important. And is generally the copy of the first most reliable document. The second type of backup is an incremental backup. This type of backup will save space and time by detecting that all the files in the full backup will remain the same. The third and final type of backup is the Differential backup. The differential backup is almost identical to the incremental file. Except with the differential backup, all the files created since the original full backup will always be copied again.
docs.title: Backups

docs.text: this is the title of the post by your name here image design by your © name make sure you keep those greater-than symbols for the image and caption to keep the formatting we need. your written content here. each paragraph is just a chunk of text and stuff. markdown lets you use special characters to format your content. for example, you can add one asterisk to get italic . add two asterisks to get bold . add three asterisks to get both italic and bold . you can use brackets and parenthesis to get link text . subheading that shows in the table of contents more content here. you get the idea. use the subheadings to break up content. each heading is indicated by a hashtag symbol. one hashtag gives you an H1, which i have reserved for the page title. two hashtags are for H2 headings that will appear in the table of contents links in the sidebar. you can have as many of these as you need, but please save them for the big sections of your document. smaller subheading that is indented in table of contents three hashtags are for H3 headings that are a little less important. you can use as many of these as you need. more content here. you get the idea. the three dashes in the next line create a horizontal rule line across the page when converted to html. resources this is where you list your sources and links: the dashes create a bullet-point list this is the link text the dashes create a bullet-point list this is the article title the dashes create a bullet-point list this is the link text
docs.title: template
